wikipedia_page.main:
Anthony Melas, better known by his stage name A!MS (pronounced "aims" which is an acronym of his previously used name A.M. SNiPER) is an English-Cypriot rapper, record producer, and entrepreneur. He is the founder and CEO of 3fifty7 Music.
A!MS has collaborated with and produced a number of artists including Afro B, Cool & Dre, The Game, Wiley and many others. He made his debut in the music scene as a member of the So Solid Crew before launching his solo career. In 2018, he was nominated for the "Man of the Year" award by Cyprus' MAD magazine for his contribution not only to the music scene but also the culture of Cyprus more specifically Ayia Napa, which is one of the largest tourist destinations of the Mediterranean.
In 2020, alongside his single release of "Diablo", A!MS featured in an episode of Trace+'s Cribs where he showcased part of his Ayia Napa retreat. He also featured in car culture magazine Fast Car that documented his passion for high performance sports cars by exhibiting part of  his personal collection.
A!MS announced the release of his single "Honor" featuring Projexx, Julian Marley and AV Allure, co-produced by Cool & Dre, as confirmed via Wonderland Magazine.As an entrepreneur, he is behind the strategic and business development of the waterpark WaterWorld including The Wave parties that was recently nominated for the 2020 InBusiness Awards and holds over 30 international awards and accolades including many WWA Wave Review and Trip-Advisor awards.A!MS is also the owner of marketing firm La Familia Marketing.He currently resides between Ayia Napa, Cyprus and London.
